tool.name: Sinkhole_Extractor

param.name: Output Directory
param.dialogReference: The directory in which the output geodatabase will be placed. This geodatabase will have the DEM mosaic and the sinkhole polygon feature class.

param.name: DEM Input Directory
param.dialogReference: The directory where the DEM tiles are found.

param.name: Output Coordinate System
param.dialogReference: The coordinate system of the original DEM tiles. This needs to be in a projected coordinate system and not a spheroidal coordinate system.

param.name: Extract Mask
param.dialogReference: A shapefile to constrain the analysis to those areas where sinkholes are expected. This should be in the same projection as the DEM data.

param.name: Processing Bit Depth
param.dialogReference:
The output bit depth of the DEM mosaic.

Selecting 32 Bit Signed option will truncate the elevation values to the nearest integer value which will ouput a smaller DEM mosaic file but will loose some elevation detail.

Selecting 32 Bit Float option will preserve the elevation values which will output a larger DEM mosaic but preserve the elevation detail.

Selecting 64 Bit will preserve the elevation values which will out a larger DEM mosaic but preserve the elevation detail. This should be selected if the 32 Bit Float option cannot provide enough value range.

param.name: Spectral Detail
param.dialogReference: During the image segmentation process this sets the level importance given to the spectral differences of features in the imagery. A default value is set to 15.5 but valid values range from 1.0 to 20.0. A higher value is appropriate when the features are spectrally similar. Smaller values create smoother outputs. If the output does not identify enough features, then raise the value. If it identifies too many features then lower the value.

param.name: Spatial Detail
param.dialogReference: During the image segmentation process this sets the level importance given to the spatial differences of features in the imagery. A default value is set to 15.5 but valid values range from 1.0 to 20.0. A higher value is appropriate when the features are spatially similar. Smaller values create smoother outputs. If the output does not identify enough features, then raise the value. If it identifies too many features then lower the value.

param.name: Min Segment Size
param.dialogReference: The minimum size of the raster object that will be output from the image segmentation process. Area is measured in the square distance units.

param.name: Minimum Area
param.displayname: Minimum Area (in map distance units squared)
param.dialogReference: The minimum size of the polygons that will be found in the output file Area is measured in the square distance units.

param.name: Maximum Area
param.displayname: Maximum Area (in map distance units squared)
param.dialogReference: The maximum size of the polygons that will be found in the output file Area is measured in the square distance units.

tool.summary: The Sinhole Extractor tool uses DEM tiles to look for and extract potential sinkholes. The user can define the minimum and maximum size of sinkholes being searched. In addition, the user can supply a mask shapefile. After creating a DEM mosaic in a user-defined geodatabase, the tool applies an image segmentation method to derive the output sinkhole polygons.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: The development of this tool was funded through a contract awarded by the Transportation Consortium of South-Central States (Tran-SET) - a consortium supported by USDoT.
dataIdInfo.idAbs: The Sinhole Extractor tool uses DEM tiles to look for and extract potential sinkholes. The user can define the minimum and maximum size of sinkholes being searched. In addition, the user can supply a mask shapefile. After creating a DEM mosaic in a user-defined geodatabase, the tool applies an image segmentation method to derive the output sinkhole polygons.
